title: Document how to write custom screen saver effects
description:
Create documentation explaining how to write custom effects for the screen-saver web component. Should cover:
- Effect base class and required methods (start, destroy, updateText)
- Animation loop patterns with requestAnimationFrame
- Handling reduced motion preferences
- External dependency loading (like Three.js)
- Configuration via data attributes
- Scene composition with multiple layers
- Examples from the advanced effects (tunnel, slideshow, snow)
close_reason: Created comprehensive documentation in docs/writing-effects.md covering Effect base class, animation patterns, external dependencies, data attributes, scene composition, and best practices

title: Optional text support with effect-specific requirements
description:
Effects should indicate whether they require text or not.

Current behavior: All effects receive text, defaulting to 'Screen Saver' if slot is empty.

Desired behavior:
1. Each effect declares if it requires text (e.g., bounce3d needs text, starfield doesn't)
2. If an effect requires text and none is provided, default to the site's domain name (window.location.hostname)
3. If an effect doesn't require text, run without any text overlay

Implementation:
- Add static 'requiresText' property to Effect base class (default: true for backwards compatibility)
- Effects like starfield, plasma, fireworks, tunnel can set requiresText = false
- Update _getSlotText() in screen-saver.js to check effect's requiresText
- If required and empty, use window.location.hostname as default
- If not required and empty, pass null/empty to effect
close_reason: Implemented optional text support. Effects declare requiresText property (default true). Effects with requiresText=false (starfield, plasma, fireworks, bubbles, pipes, mystify, tunnel, slideshow, snow) show no text when slot is empty. Effects with requiresText=true (bounce3d, matrix, ascii-glitch) default to the domain name when slot is empty.
